name: Modules.Cloud.PushNotifications
summary: Provides methods for accessing Arrow push notification channels.

methods.name: notify
methods.summary: Send a push notification to a channel.
methods.description:
Requires user login.

See push_notifications/notify.json for the request parameters supported by this method.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Parameters to send in the request.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Callback function to execute when the method completes.

methods.name: notifyTokens
methods.summary: Send a push notification to a channel to the specified devices.
methods.description: See push_notifications/notify_tokens.json for the request parameters supported by this method.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Parameters to send in the request.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Callback function to execute when the method completes.

methods.name: query
methods.summary: Custom query of push notification subscriptions with paginating.
methods.description:
See push_notifications/query.json for the request parameters supported by this method.

Data is returned in the subscriptions property of the parameter passed to the callback.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Parameters to send in the request.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Callback function to execute when the method completes.

methods.name: queryChannels
methods.summary: Returns a list of push notification channels the user is subscribed to.
methods.description:
Requires user login.

See push_notifications/channels/query.json for the request parameters supported by this method.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Parameters to send in the request.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Callback function to execute when the method completes.

methods.name: resetBadge
methods.summary: Resets the badge value to zero but does not update it on the device.
methods.description:
To update the badge in the device's UI, send a push notification to the device with the badge field defined.

The REST API call supports calling this method as either a PUT request or a GET request. This method only supports the PUT request, which means a device token must be passed to this method.

See push_notifications/reset_badge.json for the request parameter supported by this method.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Parameters to send in the request.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Callback function to execute when the method completes.

methods.name: setBadge
methods.summary: Sets the badge value but does not update it on the device.
methods.description:
To update the badge in the device's UI, send a push notification to the device with the badge field defined.

See push_notifications/set_badge.json for the request parameter supported by this method.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Parameters to send in the request.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Callback function to execute when the method completes.

methods.name: showChannels
methods.summary: Returns the number of devices subscribed to the specified channel.
methods.description:
Requires user login.

See push_notifications/channels/show.json for the request parameters supported by this method.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Parameters to send in the request.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Callback function to execute when the method completes.

methods.name: subscribe

parameters.summary: Callback function to execute when the method completes.

methods.name: updateSubscription
methods.summary: Updates a user's notification subscription with the device's location.
methods.description:
This allows an Appcelerator Dashboard administrator to send push notifications to devices located within a specified geographic region. For details, see Sending and scheduling push notifications.

See push_notifications/unsubscribe.json for the request parameters supported by this method.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Parameters to send in the request.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Callback function to execute when the method completes.
